author: lukaszrozmej
content:
not sure if here but:
<@360491619402776577> <@206016661470314496> what would you say in changing eth/69 or adding eth/70 that when propagating tx hashes we would also propagate: `Sender` and `Nonce`? Would be helpful to know if tx is in the future and if it is not DL it at the moment.

author: lukaszrozmej
content: I am wondering if it would be useful or not. It could generally lead to more sophisticated tx pull mechanism

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Hmm I have to think a bit about it. Might be useful if we switch to a pull-only strategy in the future

author: lukaszrozmej
content: ok, let me know when you will have some ideas

author: lukaszrozmej
content: I do see one problem though, malicious peers sending proper tx hashes with fake sender/nonce

author: lukaszrozmej
content:
It wouldn't be a problem if we pulled this tx, verified and rejected it, then drop the malicious peer. It might be a problem if the malicious peer would convince us not to pull the tx at all. although we would need to make our hash cache smart and keep also sender/nonce there, so if other peer announces same tx hash with different sender/nonce we would DL it.

So overall doable but implementation is complicated. Very flexible though
